data: Created a lexical resource based on WordNet by assigning sentiment scores (neutral, positive, negative) to each word sense (synsets).

Consists of nearly 5,000 short statements collected from financial news and press releases concerning Finnish companies traded on the NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange, where each item is labeled as positive, negative, or neutral.
A dataset for understanding sentiment in financial texts, combining artificial intelligence and Semantic Web technologies to better perceive, interpret, and process opinions in this context.

Includes entity-specific sentiment identification to address the challenge of headlines having multiple entities that may have conflicting sentiments. This human-categorized dataset consists of over 10,700 headlines, providing deep insights into the volatility of sentiment dependent on specific entities in financial news.

A dataset featuring word segmentation and categorization of speeches, meeting minutes, and press conference transcripts of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC). This resource aims to understand the influence of monetary policy on financial markets by analyzing the language used by the central bank.

A dataset identifying relationships within financial documents. It has approximately 29,000 examples and 22 relationship types, covering eight entity pairs (e.g., Person-Title, Organization-Money) extracted from SEC 10-X filings. Useful for identifying inter-entity relationships in financial reports.
Collected from diverse news sources and evaluated by human experts, allowing researchers to explore how headlines influence price movements, asset comparisons, and other financial events.
A dataset designed for Named Entity Recognition (NER) within the financial landscape. It aids in identifying and classifying financial companies within text data.

Provides a multilingual financial NLP dataset, featuring real-world financial article headlines in 15 languages, annotated with high-level and low-level topics, facilitating multi-class and multi-label classification tasks.

A question-answering dataset with detailed financial report analysis, written by financial experts, focusing on deep reasoning with financial data, providing training data for complex financial question answering.
